authors.name: Julien  Ghislain
authors.affiliation: Montreal Diabetes Research Center, CRCHUM, Montréal, QC, Canada.

authors.name: Vincent  Poitout
authors.affiliation: Montreal Diabetes Research Center, CRCHUM, and Department of Medicine, Université de Montréal, Montréal, QC, Canada.

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"dqqf3","text":"This protocol describes the steps to assess pancreatic beta-cell proliferation by flow cytometry. It is suitable for islets isolated from both rodents and humans. We routinely apply this protocol to quantify total and proliferating beta-cells but, with the appropriate antibody-fluorophore conjugates, can be easily adapted to assess other islet cells types (eg. alpha and delta) and markers (eg. apoptosis). Briefly, islets labelled with the proliferation marker EdU are dispersed, dead cells labeled and fixed. EdU is detected using the Click-iT Plus EdU Flow Cytometry Assay Kit and beta-cells immunostained with fluorophore-coupled anti-insulin antibodies. Beta-cell proliferation is then determined by flow cytometry by calculating the percentage of double-positive cells for EdU and insulin over the corresponding total insulin-positive cell population.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
image_attribution: Pronounced proliferation of non-beta cells in response to beta-cell mitogens in isolated human islets of Langerhans. Maachi H, Ghislain J, Tremblay C, Poitout V. Sci Rep. 2021 May 28;11(1):11283. doi: 10.1038/s41598-021-90643-3. PMID: 34050242.
keywords: flow cytometry, pancreatic islet, beta-cell, proliferation
manuscript_citation: Pronounced proliferation of non-beta cells in response to beta-cell mitogens in isolated human islets of Langerhans. Maachi H, Ghislain J, Tremblay C, Poitout V. Sci Rep. 2021 May 28;11(1):11283. doi: 10.1038/s41598-021-90643-3. PMID: 34050242.

{"blocks":[{"key":"9e2ml","text":"Flow cytometry","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fnjj6","text":"Dead-cell stain, EdU and insulin labelled cells are detected using 405-, 488-, 640-nm lasers coupled with 525/50-, 530/30-, 670/14-nm BP filters, respectively, or similar. Proliferation is calculated as the percentage of double-positive EdU+ and Ins+ cells over the total Ins+ cell population.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":240,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":249,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":275,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
